text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Since Oguri has a scrimmage during<n>her afternoon class
today, I decide to<n>eat lunch together with her.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Next to me is a bag crammed full of<n>bread and rice balls of
all assortments.<n>How did she fit that all in one bag?

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
I got these at the school shop. This<n>should be enough to get
me up and<n>running.
choice_data_list: How many meals' worth of food even is this?

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text: One meal.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
Well, almost one. I wouldn't be able<n>to run on a full
stomach, so I got just<n>enough to keep me energized.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
Whenever I go to the cafeteria, I end<n>up eating way too
much, so it's good<n>to get lunch from the school shop<n>
every once in a while.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Oguri Cap carefully spreads the<n>contents of her massive
bag around<n>her, chooses one particularly<n>smushed bread,
and begins to eat.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
In an instant, all the food she had<n>brought with her has
disappeared. It's<n>like her mouth is a black hole that<n>
vacuums anything resembling food<n>into a void.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text: That was delicious.
choice_data_list: Did you even chew any of your food?
Did you even chew any of your food?

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text: Of course I did.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
There are three rules to eating. Thank<n>the hands that made
the food. Eat<n>respectfully. And make sure to chew,<n>taste,
and swallow. That's what Tome<n>taught me.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
The folks back home taught me<n>everything important. To
repay them, I<n>need to succeed here at this<n>academy.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
That reminds me... Tome used to<n>always give me stuff to
munch on.<n>The homemade rice balls were to die<n>for.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
They were perfectly round and<n>wrapped in only the
best-tasting nori.<n>Like a cannonball, but edible.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
Each rice ball would be packed with a<n>different filling too.
Fish, meat,<n>veggies, you name it. They had it all.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
Every bite had just the right mix of<n>rice and filling, no matter
how I ate it.<n>Eating those rice balls was pure bliss.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text: Growl...

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
Hm... Even thinking about them<n>makes my stomach growl. I
guess I<n>didn't buy enough to fill me up.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text: Hmmmm... I could go back forsome more, but... I don't know if I'dmake it back on time...
choice_data_list:
If it's rice balls you're after, I have some right
here. Want one?

If it's rice balls you're after, I have some right
here. Want one?

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text: Really?! If it's okay with you...

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text: Hehe, I guess one more wouldn't<n>hurt.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Oguri Cap's eyes sparkle as I hand<n>her the rice ball. She
downs it before I<n>can even blink and looks at me<n>
expectantly.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Before I know it, all three of the rice<n>balls I brought for lunch
have<n>disappeared into the void.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
Thanks so much for the food. You<n>made these yourself,
right?

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
They remind me of the rice balls<n>Tome would give me. They
do more<n>than just fill my stomach... It's like<n>they warm
my very soul...

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text: Do you have some kind of special<n>technique?
choice_data_list: Not really. I just threw these together.
Not really. I just threw these together.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
No special technique, huh? Then<n>there's gotta be some
other secret to<n>your rice balls. I'd like to see how<n>you
make them if you don't mind.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
I've missed the taste of home ever<n>since coming here. I
wanna make<n>these for myself, so... would you mind<n>
teaching me?

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text: Thanks! I really appreciate it.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
Y'know, being around you reminds<n>me of back home. It's
very relaxing.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text: I'm so glad you're willing to be my<n>trainer.

text_block_list.name: Oguri Cap
text_block_list.text:
The nostalgic taste of the rice balls<n>really hit the spot. I feel
fully<n>recharged, both mentally and<n>physically. I'm gonna
ace that<n>scrimmage, just you wait and see!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Oguri Cap keeps to her word and<n>comes in first place—with
an<n>overwhelming lead over all the other<n>participants.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text: While I'm glad she made the most of<n>my rice balls...

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text: Growl...

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text: I kinda wish she left at least one for<n>me...
